name: Spain
description: The land of Gaudí, Picasso, and Dalí. Mediterranean beaches. The Alcázar and the Great Mosque of Córdoba. The snow-capped Sierra Nevada. The flavor of Spain can be tasted in its tapas, felt in its flamenco, and experienced through its fiestas. The country is a blend of cultures, from its unique Basque region to its Muslim-influenced south. Spain’s cosmopolitan cities exude an elegance all their own, from Madrid’s Prado to Gaudí’s Barcelona—there’s an essence to Spain that can only be captured by being there—and we can help you experience it.
bestTimeToVisit: Fall is the best time to visit, when the crowds have dispersed and the weather is cooler. Summer is the most popular time, but prepare for heat.
weather: Spain’s sheer size means that the weather forecast depends on where you’re going. The north is wetter and cooler than the south, which is dry and quite hot.

thingsToDo.name: Spanish Masters at the Prado
thingsToDo.text: Visit the Prado, truly one of the world’s greatest museums, boasting a collection that includes El Greco, Velázquez, Caravaggio, Dürer, and Botticelli.

thingsToDo.name: Michelin Stars in the Basque Region
thingsToDo.text: The Basque region has its own language, cuisine, and culture, and is known for its world-renown Michelin-starred restaurants.

thingsToDo.name: Gaudí’s Barcelona
thingsToDo.text: After strolling Las Ramblas and the Gothic Quarter, visit Barcelona’s La Sagrada Familia and Casa Batlló by Gaudí, which blend in nicely with the city’s Mediterranean spirit.

thingsToDo.name: Discover Spain’s Islamic Past
thingsToDo.text: Spain has a rich Muslim history which can be explored if you head south to the Great Mosque in Córdoba, a World Heritage Site, and to the Alcázar in Seville.

thingsToDo.name: Go Island Hopping
thingsToDo.text: Made glamourous by jet-setting celebrities, Mallorca and Ibiza offer spectacular beaches, a lively nightlife, and charming towns.

name: Greece
description: Welcome to Greece. Where the water and sky are spectacular shades of crystal blue, the sun-bleached ruins are reminders of ancient heroes and history, and the cobblestone streets filled with music and local cuisine are an introduction to a culture that’s rich in tradition.
weather: Overall Greece has a Mediterranean climate with plenty of sunshine and mild temperatures. Always check local weather before you go.
bestTimeToVisit: Any time of the year. May to August is considered the peak season, and September and October are also popular as it’s not too hot.

thingsToDo.name: Travel back in time at the Acropolis
thingsToDo.text: Athens is the birthplace of democracy and Western civilization, and the Acropolis and Parthenon are its iconic reminders.

thingsToDo.name: See a Santorini sunset
thingsToDo.text: Grab a seat and witness a truly surreal sunset with stunning views from several cliff-side vantage points.

thingsToDo.name: Make the most of Mykonos
thingsToDo.text: Famous for its glamorous nightlife and gorgeous beaches, the island is bustling with activities all day and night.

thingsToDo.name: Day trip to Delphi
thingsToDo.text: Overlooking a dramatic ravine, this sanctuary of Apollo was considered the center of the world. With ruins of temples, theater, and a magnificent stadium, it brings Greek myths to life.

thingsToDo.name: Discover Crete
thingsToDo.text: Enjoy the local-feel of a small village, drive along the breathtaking rugged south coast, bask in luxurious spas—options are aplenty in this largest Greek island.

name: Austria
description: Austria blends the best of old-world charm, cosmopolitan city life, and breathtaking Alpine landscapes. Our Austria vacation packages can take you wandering the old town of Salzburg or tracing the footsteps of Mozart. Step onto the living set of the Sound of Music. Vienna’s Baroque and Rococo architecture rings with classical music. Feel the spirit of Klimt, Mozart, Freud, and Mahler in the city’s cafés. Beyond Vienna, journey to the Danube Valley, and visit Austria’s national parks for alpine hiking. In the winter, the mountain resorts come alive.
weather: Depends on the season. Spring and fall bring temperatures in the mid 40s to high 60s. June to August brings temperatures in the 70s. And winter brings chilly weather in the 30s and 40s.
bestTimeToVisit: Fall and spring are quieter times to visit and offer milder temperatures, while winter brings crowds to the Alpine resorts

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Hofburg
thingsToDo.text: The Hofburg is the Imperial Palace in Vienna, the capital city of Austria. In the days of old this would have been the home of the Royal Family who were known as the Hasburgs. Nowadays however the palace is used by the President although parts of it can also be visited by the public.

thingsToDo.name: Trek the Krimmler Ache
thingsToDo.text: The Krimmler Ache is the tallest waterfall in Austria and it has a drop of 380 meters. To get here you will first have to make your way to the delightful town of Krimml which sits at 1,076 meters above sea level before trekking out to the Krimmler Ache. From Krimml you will find a selection of exquisite hiking trails to choose from and this is a great spot to spend several days enjoying the great Austrian outdoors.

thingsToDo.name: Pay tribute to Mozart in Salzburg
thingsToDo.text: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart was born in Salzburg in Austria in 1756. His humble home at Number 9 Getreidegasse has now been turned into a museum which is aptly named Mozart’s Birthplace and you will find family memorabilia, musical instruments, and paintings of Mozart all over the house.

thingsToDo.name: Hike the Kitzbüheler Horn
thingsToDo.text: Standing proud in the Tyrol Region of Austria is the Kitzbüheler Horn which is almost 2,000 meters high. It is known for being one of the most spectacular peaks in Austria and you can take a cable car to the top or trek to the summit from the village of Kitzbühel if you are feeling active. Once at the top, you will have views all over the scenic valleys blow.

thingsToDo.name: Go skiing in Arlberg
thingsToDo.text: Austria is of course famous for its ski resorts but one of the most popular of these is Arlberg. Both professional and beginner skiers love Arlberg as there are a range of runs here for all levels of ability and the main ski resort provides ski equipment and classes.

name: Czech Republic
description: Located in the heart of Central Europe, the Czech Republic is one of the most sought-after destinations. This modern little country with an exciting history and deep-rooted traditions boasts of castles and chateaux, elegant spas resorts and stunning national parks, and of course, the world’s finest Pilsner beer. Whether you want to experience the magic of Prague or explore the country's medieval towns, our consultants can customize your trip with just the right Czech Republic vacation package to make it a one-of-a-kind trip
weather: Overall, it is moderately continental, with cold winters (December-February being the coldest) and warm summers. Always check local weather before traveling.
bestTimeToVisit: May-September is considered the busiest season, as most festivals and activities are held to make the most of the good weather.

thingsToDo.name: Dine in the Dancing House
thingsToDo.text: Officially known as Nationale-Nederlanden building, it is a fine example of contemporary architecture. Besides being a famous landmark, the building houses Celeste Restaurant, which welcomes the locals and city’s guests.

thingsToDo.name: Hit the Pubs
thingsToDo.text: The Czech Republic is a famous producer of beer. Various brands produce numerous blends, that have gain notoriety in Europe. Meanwhile, a lot of historic pubs are still open and invite guests to check out the local production!

thingsToDo.name: Visit Olomouc
thingsToDo.text: One of the biggest towns in the country has a Medieval university, which attracts young people from around. Moreover, it boasts an abundance of historic monuments protected by UNESCO.

thingsToDo.name: Walk the Charles Bridge
thingsToDo.text: One of the most popular landmarks in Prague, it also qualifies as one of the most iconic bridges in the world! Commissioned by King Charles IV, the construction of the structure was finished in the 15th century.

thingsToDo.name: Relax in Karlovy Vary
thingsToDo.text: Also known as Carlsbad, be introduced to the famous spa town. It boasts hot springs, whose water is used for various purposes. Pools and spa centers attract visitors from all over the country as well as Europe to have some pleasurable treatments.

name: England
description: Welcome to England. A land steeped in history, royalty, and culture. Head over to London’s most vibrant, cosmopolitan streets. Marvel at the wonder of Stonehenge. Explore Leeds Castle or spend an idyllic day on the south coast by Brighton Beach. Take a tour to the rolling countryside and charismatic villages. No matter which vacation package you choose, one thing’s certain, you will leave smitten by England’s charm.
weather: Relatively temperate and temperamental. While it doesn't experience extremes during either summer or winter, it’s best to pack an umbrella.
bestTimeToVisit: Any time of the year. Overall, spring (late March to early June) and autumn (September to November) are most popular, when it's usually warm and dry.

thingsToDo.name: Watch one of Shakespeare’s plays in his hometown
thingsToDo.text: Shakespeare’s Globe on the South Bank in London is a pretty special spot to watch one of the Bard’s beloved plays, but there’s nowhere better than Will’s hometown in Warwickshire. Head to Stratford-upon-Avon to see a performance at the Royal Shakespeare Theatre on the river’s edge.

thingsToDo.name: Follow in the footsteps of The Beatles
thingsToDo.text: Take a magical mystery tour around the city of Liverpool in northwest England. It’s where the famous foursome first met. Step inside the National Trust-owned homes where John Lennon and Paul McCartney spent their childhoods. Head to The Beatles Story, the world’s largest permanent exhibition devoted to the musical icons and their history.

thingsToDo.name: Stroll along the South Bank in London
thingsToDo.text: There’s so much to see in central London it’s hard to know where to start. We’d recommend setting off from the gardens beneath the London Eye, with views of Big Ben and the Houses of Parliament, and walking east along the South Bank.

thingsToDo.name: Fly a broomstick at the Harry Potter Studio Tour
thingsToDo.text: Potterheads the world over will know England as the home of The Boy Who Lived. There are filming locations dotted all over the country, but true fans will want to head straight for Leavesden Studios, where the majority of the movies were filmed.

thingsToDo.name: Sip sparkling wine on an English vineyard
thingsToDo.text: Not many people think of wine when they think of the English countryside, but Chapel Down vineyard in Kent is giving France a run for its money. The Chapel Down winery is set in 22 acres of vineyards and it’s open to visitors all year round.

name: France
description: France is the world’s leading travel destination and for good reason. With us, you can stroll Paris’s bohemian Latin Quarter, see the Mona Lisa at the Louvre, and view the glittering Eiffel Tower. Glamour meets the coast in the sun-drenched French Riviera. Bask in the sun in the Côte d’Azur’s St. Tropez, Nice, and Cannes. Ski the French Alps, follow the Michelin Guide to some of the world’s most renowned three-star restaurants, or journey to a Château in Bordeaux or Burgundy, and taste the local wines.
weather: Temperatures vary from average lows in the mid-thirties in the winter to highs in the mid-seventies in the summer. Pack an umbrella for July.
bestTimeToVisit: June to August brings ideal weather, and the crowds. September to October is beautiful and less crowded.

thingsToDo.name: Get a Little Glamour in the French Riviera
thingsToDo.text: Bask on the beaches of the Côte d’Azur, and follow the stars to Cannes and St. Tropez, or wander the flower market of Nice.

thingsToDo.name: Follow the Wine Trail
thingsToDo.text: Taste some of France’s most exquisite wines in Burgundy, toast your day with authentic Champagne in Champagne, or visit Bordeaux to trace winemaking from the vine to your glass.

thingsToDo.name: Parisian Masterpieces
thingsToDo.text: Leonardo da Vinci, Michelangelo, and Rembrandt, Venus de Milo and the Winged Victory in the Louvre; Notre Dame and the Eiffel Tower—Paris is a city of artistic and architectural masterpieces.

name: Italy
description: Language and culture, food and fashion, art and architecture, history and myths... all fill your senses as you set foot in bella Italia. Whether it’s the gondola rides and soft sunsets at Venice, the sweeping landscape and vineyards in Tuscany or the iconic larger-than-life sites in Rome—Italy invites you to slow down and soak it all in.
weather: The climate varies considerably from the north to the south of Italy. North has extreme winters and summer. Central is milder, as is the South. Always check local weather.
bestTimeToVisit: Any time of the year. Overall, April to June and September to October are most popular, when it’s comfortably warm.

thingsToDo.name: Go on a Gondola
thingsToDo.text: See Venice as it was intended to be seen, from the water. Let your gondolier take you through the quiet canals for an enchanting time.

thingsToDo.name: Tour Pompeii
thingsToDo.text: Carved out of a single block of marble, Michelangelo's statue of David is truly iconic. See it in the 'flesh' at the Accademia Gallery in Florence.

thingsToDo.name: Rome on Wheels
thingsToDo.text: From the Spanish Steps, Colosseum, and Pantheon, to the gorgeous Trevi Fountain—pick a bike, Segway, Vespa, or golf cart tour to see it all.

name: Arizona
description: Arizona is known as the “Grand Canyon State” and for good reason. There are few places on earth that find themselves on most people’s bucket lists, and standing on the rim of the Grand Canyon, watching the sun set over the ribbons of red rock, is one of them.
weather: Summers can get into the triple digits. Winters are mild, but pack a jacket if you plan to visit higher elevations.
bestTimeToVisit: Visit between November and April, when the weather is mild. In the Spring, the desert blossoms.

thingsToDo.name: Sunset on the Rim of the Grand Canyon
thingsToDo.text: As the sun sets, six million years of exposed rock in this UNESCO World Heritage site turn bright red, deep purple, and orange—a breathtaking experience.

thingsToDo.name: Feel the Energy of Sedona
thingsToDo.text: Sedona is a wild landscape of red rocks and pilgrims looking to capture the energy vortexes said to exist among the stones.

thingsToDo.name: Find Your Oasis
thingsToDo.text: In Arizona, many of the spa experiences come with stunning views of the desert or the red rocks, and incorporate native traditions and New Age healing rituals.

name: California
description: California’s relaxed vibe, beautiful beaches, and pristine wilderness draws diverse crowds. There’s San Francisco’s iconic Golden Gate bridge, Los Angeles’s glitzy movie scene, and San Diego’s famous zoo. Taste your way through the Sonoma and Napa wine valleys. Venture to California’s iconic national parks. Stand before Yosemite’s granite cliffs, marvel at Sequoia National Park’s majestic trees, and experience the awe-inspiring silence of the Mojave Desert. Drive along the Pacific Coast Highway and see Big Sur.
weather: California’s climate is warm and dry in the summer and mild and wet in the winter. If you’re visiting the desert or the mountains, you’ll experience more extreme weather.
bestTimeToVisit: Year-round

thingsToDo.name: Ride a Cable Car in San Francisco
thingsToDo.text: You can ride San Francisco’s iconic cable cars through the city’s neighborhoods and destinations. See the Golden Gate Bridge, Fisherman’s Wharf, and the Mission District.

thingsToDo.name: Land of National Parks
thingsToDo.text: Few national parks evoke quite the awe that Yosemite inspires. See the massive granite cliffs from Glacier Point. Visit Sequoia and see the world’s largest trees, or venture into the desert and visit Joshua Tree or Death Valley.

thingsToDo.name: Search for the Stars in Hollywood
thingsToDo.text: Los Angeles is still the land where movies are made. Visit Hollywood or Disneyland in nearby Anaheim.

name: Florida
description: Whether you want the vibrant nightlife and Latin flavor of Miami’s South Beach, the surf culture of Cocoa Beach, the quiet shores of Anastasia State Park, or the powder white sand and sunsets of Sarasota’s Gulf beaches, there’s a beach to match your style.
weather: Mild weather most of the year, with hot and humid summers.
bestTimeToVisit: Winter brings milder temperatures. Summers can be quite hot, though popular.

thingsToDo.name: Snorkel John Pennekamp State Park
thingsToDo.text: Florida has the only living coral barrier reef in the United States, and you can snorkel or dive it at John Pennekamp State Park in the Florida Keys.

thingsToDo.name: Feel Miami’s Latin Spirit
thingsToDo.text: Miami boasts a blend of Caribbean, South American, and Central American culture and cuisine, with a backdrop of Art Deco architecture.

thingsToDo.name: Soak with the Manatees in a Cold Spring
thingsToDo.text: Florida has more springs than any other state—from the natural lazy river of Ichetucknee Springs to the winter manatee haven at Manatee Springs.

name: New York
description: After you’ve visited New York City’s landmarks, venture beyond to the wonders of New York State. See the New York side of Niagara Falls. Go boating, swimming, or climbing at Lake George in the Adirondacks. Visit the Hudson Valley’s Catskills for fall foliage, hiking, and biking. The Storm King Art Center and the Women’s Rights National Historic Park in Seneca Falls are museums off the beaten path. Long Island boasts State Park beaches and wineries.
weather: New York has all four seasons. In the summer, temperatures are in the 80s (but are warmer in New York City). Fall and spring bring milder temperatures, with winter temperatures ranging from the teens to the high thirties.
bestTimeToVisit: Year-round

thingsToDo.name: Visit New York City
thingsToDo.text: The Statue of Liberty, the Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center, and Broadway—New York City offers nightlife, parks, cuisine, museums, and history.

thingsToDo.name: See Spectacular Niagara Falls
thingsToDo.text: Take the Maid of the Mist Boat tour to the base of the falls, or enjoy time at the Niagara Falls casinos.

thingsToDo.name: Get Outside in New York
thingsToDo.text: The Adirondacks and the Catskill Mountains offer year-round outdoor fun, from skiing in the winter to hiking, mountain biking, and climbing in the summer, to watching the fall foliage in the autumn.

name: Hawaii
description: Golden-sand beaches, cascading waterfalls, lush rainforests, rugged canyons, and spectacular sunsets… Hawaii is the paradise destination that exceeds expectations.
weather: Temperatures are consistently warm but comfortable throughout the year.
bestTimeToVisit: Year-round

thingsToDo.name: Indulge in a traditional Hawaiian luau
thingsToDo.text: Get entertained by Hawaiian musicians, hula dancers, and fire twirlers, alongside an authentic feast.

thingsToDo.name: Check out three beaches (in three colors)
thingsToDo.text: Big Island’s black, white, and green beaches are a sight to behold and certainly great to explore.

thingsToDo.name: Experience an ocean adventure
thingsToDo.text: Snorkeling, scuba diving, surfing, whale watching, a sunset cruise… there are plenty of choices, and Hawaii the perfect location for all.

name: Texas
description: Texas is ranch country, deserts, big cities, and remote wilderness. There’s Austin’s live music scene, Dallas’ museums, and Houston’s NASA Johnson Space Center. While in the big city, grab some delicious Tex-Mex. Visit the Alamo outside San Antonio. Beyond the cities, you’ll find miles of coastline and the natural splendor of Big Bend National Park.
weather: Weather varies depending on where you’re going in the state. South Texas sees year-round mild weather, while the north gets cooler.
bestTimeToVisit: Year-round

thingsToDo.name: Raft, Hike, and Soak in Big Bend National Park
thingsToDo.text: Big Bend National Park has a natural hot spring by the Rio Grande. Hike the Chisos Mountain Range, and raft down Santa Elena Canyon.

thingsToDo.name: San Antonio’s River Walk
thingsToDo.text: After visiting the Alamo, take a stroll down San Antonio’s River Walk where you can people-watch, eat, and enjoy the scenery.

thingsToDo.name: Beach Time at South Padre Island
thingsToDo.text: Go deep sea fishing, watch for sea turtles, and get your adrenaline going with kite surfing or kiteboarding.

name: China
description: With its bustling cities, iconic relics, tombs, and temples, China is an incredible country of great diversity. The list of sights to see and things to do is virtually endless. From the stunning skyscrapers of Hong Kong to the ancient Great Wall, the mighty Yangtze river to the incredible Terracotta Warriors, China is where centuries old traditions blend with urban flair. Where rugged natural scenery and cutting-edge technology both have their rightful place.
weather: Chinese climate varies from region to region. Always check weather based on destination.
bestTimeToVisit: April-October, when the weather is warm and dry.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Beijing Opera
thingsToDo.text: Enjoy the fascinating music, singing, costumes and performance of a traditional opera. Then try on a few opera costumes and make-up, too.

thingsToDo.name: Explore the Forbidden City
thingsToDo.text: Visit the Forbidden City with a local guide and learn about the Imperial Palace which was home to 24 emperors from 1420 until 1924.

thingsToDo.name: Head to the Great Wall, China
thingsToDo.text: Take a tour of one of the great wonders of the world as it winds up and down across varied terrains like a dragon.

thingsToDo.name: Ride the Shanghai Maglev Train
thingsToDo.text: Take a ride on the world's fastest, most futuristic passenger train. At the speed of 268 mph, you'll zip from the downtown Beijing area to the airport in only eight minutes!

name: Japan
description: A mystifying blend of modern and ancient, every aspect of Japan will leave you fascinated. This 'Land of the Rising Sun' with Cherry Blossoms, sushi, saké and Zen gardens, that are so integrated in world culture, is a bucket-list destination for most. Whether you immerse yourself in the hustle-bustle of Tokyo, the traditional splendor of Kyoto or the volcanic hot springs of Fukuoka’s—Japan's blend of tradition, natural wonder, and ultra-modernity makes it a country unlike any other.
weather: Generally temperate, with four distinct seasons.
bestTimeToVisit: March-May and from September-November.

thingsToDo.name: Visit Mt. Fuji
thingsToDo.text: Whether you hike to the top or take it all in from the observation deck, visiting this UNESCO World Heritage site is an unforgettable experience.

thingsToDo.name: Go on a fast ride
thingsToDo.text: Hop onto a Japan Railways bullet train from Tokyo to Kyoto, and watch the Japanese countryside whiz by in a 220 mph blur.

thingsToDo.name: Indulge in sushi
thingsToDo.text: Dine on the finest sushi, served at popular hole-in-the-wall joints to Michelin-starred masterpieces in Tokyo.

thingsToDo.name: Explore historic Kyoto
thingsToDo.text: One of the few cities spared the devastation of World War II, the streets and architecture have remained unchanged for over 1,000 years.

name: Thailand
description: From glittering temples to gorgeous tropical beaches, Thailand is a fascinating land of culture, history, and charm. There’s plenty to do in this enchanting nation of gilded Buddhas, Royal palaces and the ever-welcoming Thai smile and grace. You could enjoy Bangkok's Siam Square by day and night. Relax on the tropical beaches of Phuket. Try authentic Thai cuisine with only the freshest local ingredients, and spend some up-close time with elephants—the choices are aplenty.
weather: Tropical, with hot, cold and rainy seasons.
bestTimeToVisit: November-early April, when it’s cooler and dry.

thingsToDo.name: Head to Phi Phi islands
thingsToDo.text: A great getaway for beach relaxation as well as diving, snorkeling, kayaking, and other marine recreation.

thingsToDo.name: Get cultured at Chiang Mai
thingsToDo.text: Explore temples dating to the 1300s, and a night bazaar that stretches across several city blocks for a culturally-rich experience.

thingsToDo.name: Go shopping at the Floating Market
thingsToDo.text: Ride a boat to this Bangkok market, where vendor boats sell everything from fresh fruits and flowers to clothing and souvenirs.

thingsToDo.name: Have fun with elephants
thingsToDo.text: Elephant Hills' Jungle Safari is fun for everyone. Enjoy taking care of Asian elephants, including washing, feeding, and watching them roam free.

thingsToDo.name: Explore Bangkok's Wat Pho temple
thingsToDo.text: Immerse yourself in the ancient past and marvel at the famed golden Reclining Buddha.

name: Brazil
weather: In general, Brazil is a year-round destination with temperatures rarely dip below 20°C (68°F), apart from in the mountains and southern regions. The climate varies from hot and dry in the arid interior to humid and sticky in the tropical rainforests of the Amazon jungle.
description: Brazil boasts more than 70 national parks and dozens of monuments, including one of the Seven New Wonders of the World – Christ the Redeemer, in Rio de Janeiro. Together, these attractions create one of the most appealing and exciting destinations in South America. People come from every corner of the world to discover the superlative coastline, sprawling metropolises and thick jungles, which are home to monkeys, jaguars and river dolphins. The vast Brazilian landscape holds many prized spots, yet the places below are some of the very best destinations in the country.
bestTimeToVisit: Overall, the months of September and October are the best time to vacation in Brazil, as you will avoid the major holiday periods as well as the chilly southern winter and the rainy season in the Pantanal

thingsToDo.name: See the Cristo Redentor and Corcovado, Rio de Janeiro
thingsToDo.text: With arms outstretched 28 meters, as if to encompass all of humanity, the colossal Art Deco statue of Christ, called Cristo Redentor (Christ the Redeemer), gazes out over Rio de Janeiro and the bay from the summit of Corcovado.

thingsToDo.name: Sugar Loaf, Rio de Janeiro
thingsToDo.text: The easily recognized emblem of Rio de Janeiro, the rounded rock peak of Sugar Loaf juts out of a tree-covered promontory, rising 394 meters above the beaches and city. Its summit is one of the first places to visit for tourists, for views of Rio and the harbor, and for the thrill of riding suspended in a cable car between Sugar Loaf and the Morro da Urca, a lower peak from which a second cableway connects to the city.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Iguaçu Falls
thingsToDo.text: At the point where Brazil, Paraguay, and Argentina meet, the Iguaçu river drops spectacularly in a semicircle of 247 waterfalls that thunder down into the gorge below. Just above the falls, the river is constricted to one-fourth of its usual width, making the force of the water even stronger.

thingsToDo.name: Experience the Carnaval in Rio de Janeiro
thingsToDo.text: Few shows match Rio's pre-Lenten Carnaval (Carnival) extravaganza for color, sound, action, and exuberance. Make no mistake, this is not just another rowdy street party, but a carefully staged showpiece, where spectators can watch the parades of competing samba dancers from a purpose-built stadium designed by none other than Brazil's best-known architect, Oscar Niemeyer.

thingsToDo.name: Amazon rain forests
thingsToDo.text: About 20 kilometers southeast of Manaus, the dark Rio Negro waters meet the light muddy water of the Rio Solimões, flowing side by side for about six kilometers before mixing as the Amazon. Boat trips from Manaus take you to this point, called Encontro das Aguas, meeting of the waters. Other boat trips take you into the heart of the rain forests and the network of rivers, channels, and lakes formed by the three rivers. In the Rio Negro, the Anavilhanas Islands form an archipelago with lakes, streams, and flooded forests that offer a full cross-section of the Amazonian ecosystem.

name: Colombia
weather: Colombia's weather offers all four seasons and they remain generally unchanged throughout the year due to Colombia's proximity to the equator.
description: Colombia has something that will please most travelers, from sandy beaches of the Caribbean and Pacific coasts, to the Andes Mountains and the Amazon rainforests. Its heritage reflects the culture of its indigenous peoples as well as the Spanish who began settling here in the early 15th century.
bestTimeToVisit: The best time to visit Colombia is during the summer months of July and August and the winter months of December and January. These months have some of the lowest rainfall of the year.

thingsToDo.name: Walk Old Cartagena
thingsToDo.text: Designated as a UNESCO World Heritage site in 1984, walking through the historic city center of Cartagena continues to be one of the top things to do in Colombia for travelers from around the world. As you walk the streets or, perhaps, take a carriage ride instead, you can't help but feel transported back in time.

thingsToDo.name: Relax in Parque Tayrona
thingsToDo.text: Located on the Caribbean coast about six hours east of Cartagena, Parque Tayrona is a relatively undeveloped national park where the jungle meets secluded beaches.

thingsToDo.name: Party in Medellin
thingsToDo.text: Enjoy the constant Spring-like weather of Medellin with a night out on the town. While Parque Lleras is the central nightlife district (referred to locally as La Zona Rosa), there are plenty of other options too. Barrio Colombia, Las Palmas, La 70, and La 33 all feature a variety of nightclubs (discotecas) for travelers to party with the locals.

thingsToDo.name: Go Horseback Riding in Valle de Cocora
thingsToDo.text: The Valle de Cocora is a national park situated in the center of Colombia's coffee-growing region. The valley is home to the world's tallest palm tree, the wax palm, which is also the national tree of Colombia. Horseback riding in Valle de Cocora offers a fun way to experience the region's natural beauty.

thingsToDo.name: Learn to Salsa in Cali
thingsToDo.text: Widely considered one of the top salsa dancing cities in the world, Cali is home to some of the country's top professional dancers.

name: Chile
description: Most of the guidebooks will tell you to take your time with Chile.  It’s made for slow adventure and best suited for those who travel with a heart and mind open to experiencing the moment. Chile is uniquely shaped, long and narrow, which can make travelling the country a little challenging. With over 4,000km from one end to the other, you can expect long and always interesting bus rides on your way to explore deserts, fertile valleys, volcanoes, lakes, fjords, glaciers, the Andes mountain range, dunes, and incredible coastline.
weather: It is warm all year round. There is a very large daily range of temperate, up to 30 degrees celsius. Central Chile has a mediterranean type climate with long, hot summers and cool, wet winters.
bestTimeToVisit: The best time to visit Chile depends on the region you’re traveling to. October to March are the warmest and most accessible months for visitors heading to Patagonia, in the south of the country. This is summer in the Southern Hemisphere and the weather is very pleasant, with warm temperatures of around 72°F.

thingsToDo.name: Valparaiso
thingsToDo.text: One of the most unique cities in Chile is Valparaiso.  Climbing up the sides of 42 hills, the city has a bohemian vibe that everyone loves.  There are several funiculars that take you up and down various hills so that you can enjoy the view and the many colourful houses at the top.

thingsToDo.name: Torres Del Paine
thingsToDo.text: You really can’t miss the granite pillars of Torres del Pain, or the Tower of Paine.  They rise more than 2000m over the Patagonian steppe and dominate what is possibly the most majestic national park in all of South America.

thingsToDo.name: Santiago
thingsToDo.text: The capital and largest city in Chile is Santiago.  It sits in a valley surrounded by the breathtaking snow capped Andes Mountains.  Locals will tell you that Santiago IS Chile, and it really won’t take long before you agree.

thingsToDo.name: The Lake District
thingsToDo.text: If you want nature, Chile’s lake district is the place to go. Alerce (Larch) forests, volcanoes capped with snow, fabulous mountain lakes, traditional folklore and handicrafts, and year-round outdoor adventure can all be found here.

name: Egypt
description: Magnificent monuments, ancient wonders, boundless sandy deserts, the mighty Nile, and the chaotic allure of Cairo are just some of the many things that make Egypt a classic travel destination. From the mystery of the Pyramids and the imposing Great Sphinx of Giza to the turquoise waters of the Red Sea and the endless sand dunes of the Sahara, Egypt’s landscapes are incredibly inspiring.
weather: Mostly hot and dry, temperatures may vary by region.
bestTimeToVisit: October-April, when temperatures are cooler but still pleasantly warm.

thingsToDo.name: Tour the Pyramids and the Sphinx
thingsToDo.text: Wander and wonder around the Great Pyramids and Sphinx of Giza. Venture out into the desert plateau for the best views of all three pyramids.

thingsToDo.name: Learn a little history in Luxor
thingsToDo.text: Known as the 'World's Largest Open-Air Museum,' Luxor features famous historical temples and the Valleys of the Kings & Queens.

thingsToDo.name: Head to the old city - Coptic Cairo
thingsToDo.text: Several centuries old, this part of Cairo has ancient churches and twisting alleyways with beautiful mosaics and woodwork.

thingsToDo.name: Go on a white desert safari
thingsToDo.text: Take a 4x4 into the White Desert National Park, and witness a region of brilliant-white rock formations.

name: South Africa
weather: Mostly temperate, though temperatures vary by region and season.
bestTimeToVisit: All year round. May-September for Safari. November-February for birdwatching. July-November for whale-watching.
description: South Africa is a country unlike any other. From the world’s best safaris, to the most dramatic landscapes and amazing history and culture, this is a country that will enthrall and surprise you at every turn. Hike up the famous Table Mountain. Go on a luxury safari. Fly high in a hot-air balloon over the countryside. Re-visit the place Nelson Mandela made history—the choices are aplenty on your South African vacation.

thingsToDo.name: Take a table top hike
thingsToDo.text: Hike up the famous Table Mountain for the stunning views and vistas. Don’t want to walk? Take a five-minute cable car ride all the way to the top.

thingsToDo.name: Say hello to African penguins
thingsToDo.text: Head to Boulders Beach, Cape Town and get up close to the only species of penguins acclimatized to the warm South African climate.

thingsToDo.name: Tour the Winelands
thingsToDo.text: Take a trip through the scenic and historic Cape Winelands, with exquisite wine tasting at local farms in Paarl, Stellenbosch, and Franschhoek.

thingsToDo.name: Try a balloon safari
thingsToDo.text: Watch the balloons being prepared on the field, then climb aboard with your pilot, and it's up, up, and away! Enjoy a bird’s eye-view of the beautiful valley.

thingsToDo.name: Go on a world-famous safari
thingsToDo.text: Head to Kruger National Park for a chance to see the 'Big Five': lion, leopard, buffalo, elephant, and rhino, as well as an astounding diversity of other wildlife.

name: Tanzania
description: From Mt. Kilimanjaro and Zanzibar, to the vast Serengeti, a visit to East Africa's largest country is sure to delight. You'll find nature's most majestic wildlife, the planet's most incredible landscapes, and the continent's most welcoming people in Tanzania. Whether you’re in search of “The Big Five” or the stunning Wildebeest Migration, you'll be spoiled for choice when choosing a safari. Plus, the idyllic beaches and the centuries old Swahili culture add to its magic.
weather: The climate is diverse with two rainy seasons.
bestTimeToVisit: June-September when it’s cooler and dry is considered the popular season for animal-sighting.

thingsToDo.name: Meet the Chimpanzees
thingsToDo.text: See the protected chimpanzees, made famous by primatologist Jane Goodall, in the forests of Gombe Stream National Park.

thingsToDo.name: Head to the Ngorongoro crater
thingsToDo.text: Check out vast herds of wildebeests, zebras, gazelles, buffalo, and their predators, the big cats as they roam the crater floor.

thingsToDo.name: Catch a sunset at Serengeti National Park
thingsToDo.text: See the landscape turn red and gold by the setting sun, silhouetting the wildlife around you.

thingsToDo.name: Take a hike
thingsToDo.text: Climb Mt. Kilimanjaro with a guided tour or just soak in its majestic presence.

name: Antarctica
bestTimeToVisit: The best time to visit Antarctica is February and early March, which brings the best weather for crossing the Drake Passage, the warmest weather on the continent, and the best time for wildlife viewing.
description: Antarctica is the world’s last great wilderness. Uninhabited by humans, to get to this continent, travelers journey the way that Cook, Amundsen, and Shackleton did—by boat. Even in the austral summer, this is a land vulnerable to extremes. The days are long, and the sun might not set at all near the solstice. View whales, seals, penguins, and migratory birds in abundance. The drama of nature is on full display here: witness melting glaciers, marvel at blue ice floes, and trek over ice deserts.
weather: Visitors to Antarctica should prepare for cold and changing weather conditions. While temperatures in the austral summer can get as warm as 60 degrees Fahrenheit, visitors should prepare for temperatures that average around freezing and days that can drop well below freezing.

thingsToDo.name: Bird-Watchers’ Paradise
thingsToDo.text: Antarctica is home to Gentoo, Adélie, and chinstrap penguins. You can also see albatrosses, terns, as well as migratory birds that travel to the continent to nest every year.

thingsToDo.name: Wildlife Viewing
thingsToDo.text: From whale-watching to seal sightings, Antarctica is home to killer whales and the Weddell seal.

thingsToDo.name: Paddle a Sea Kayak
thingsToDo.text: Get up close to icebergs and wildlife by paddling a sea kayak along the coast, where you might glimpse penguins, seals, and whales.

thingsToDo.name: Hike in the Footsteps of Explorers
thingsToDo.text: Hike to Ernest Shackleton’s lodge and see a historic site preserved by the cold and ice.

thingsToDo.name: Watch the Calving Ice
thingsToDo.text: A cruise to Antarctica includes many quiet moments where you’ll pass icebergs and the frozen coast, and moments where you can observe the melting glaciers—evidence of how human impact continues to change the continent.

name: Australia
weather: December – February is summertime, and June to August is winter, but the climate varies across the continent
bestTimeToVisit: Depends on where you’re going, but the Great Barrier Reef area offers year-round warmth
description: Australia offers beautiful beaches, a wilderness that spans from the Outback to the rugged coast, and incredible dining and cultural opportunities in its cosmopolitan cities. Snorkel or dive the Great Barrier Reef, the largest coral reef on the planet. On the coast, you’ll find the vibrant city of Sydney with its iconic Opera House, and the seaside culture and turquoise water of Bondi Beach. Explore Australia’s wine regions, Daintree Rainforest, its breathtaking deserts, or meet a koala and kangaroo in the city or wild.

thingsToDo.name: Snorkel or Dive the Great Barrier Reef
thingsToDo.text: The Great Barrier Reef is one of the natural wonders of the world and you can explore it by diving, snorkeling, or even spend a night on a pontoon under the stars.

thingsToDo.name: Sip Your Way Through South Australia
thingsToDo.text: Just outside Adelaide, you’ll find a land of vineyards and wineries, perfect for a wine tasting adventure or tour.

thingsToDo.name: Drive Victoria’s Great Ocean Road
thingsToDo.text: Whale watch, paddle Lower Glenelg National Park, discover quiet beaches, taste incredible cuisine, and shop; there are destinations and views for the whole family to enjoy.

thingsToDo.name: Hang Ten at Bondi Beach
thingsToDo.text: After you’ve visited the Sydney Opera House and other iconic landmarks, make your way to the restaurants, shops, and surf culture of Bondi Beach.

name: Bahamas
description: While vibrant Nassau and Paradise Island are among the more popular Bahamas destinations, the Bahamas boasts over 700 islands offering white-sand beaches and remote escapes. Let your Paradise Travel consultant connect you with diving, snorkeling, or fishing adventures. If a resort is more your style, Atlantis Paradise Island is a world onto itself, with its own casino, water park, shopping, spas, beaches, marine exhibits, and incredible dining. Then there’s Grand Bahama Island, which offers everything from a National Park to Freeport’s glitz, gambling, and golf.
bestTimeToVisit: Mid-December to Mid-April brings the best weather
weather: The subtropical climate brings cool trade winds in the summer and warm Gulf Stream breezes in the winter. Temperatures average 75˚ in the winter and 84˚ in the summer. June 1 – November 30 is hurricane season.

thingsToDo.name: Swim with the Pigs of the Exumas
thingsToDo.text: Cruise to the remote and beautiful Exumas where you can swim with seafaring pigs.

thingsToDo.name: Get in Touch with Nature at Lucayan National Park
thingsToDo.text: If you visit in the winter, hike the mangroves, explore Burial Mound Cave (the park boasts the largest underwater cave system in the world), and bask on the beautiful Gold Rock Beach.

thingsToDo.name: Explore Nassau
thingsToDo.text: Nassau is rich with Bahamian history and culture: stroll the Nassau Straw Market, step back in time at Fort Charlotte, or sip Bahamian rum at John Watling’s Distillery.

thingsToDo.name: Take a Sunset Cruise
thingsToDo.text: The Bahamas are best experienced at sea, either by catamaran or by sailboat.

name: Barbados
description: For an island that’s just 21 miles long and 14 miles wide, Barbados sure has a lot to offer. A stunning coastline with pristine white-sand beaches that turn pink at sunrise. Lush interiors with plantations, gardens, and plenty of wildlife. A cultural heritage remnant of its former time as a British colony, and a plethora of activities—from watching a Polo match and taking a rum tour to sailing and snorkeling in the crystal-clear waters, this little island does have it all.
bestTimeToVisit: December-June is a popular time to visit as it is dry, though February-April is considered as the peak season.
weather: It’s generally warm and sunny all year round with an average daytime high of 75-85°F, cooled by trade winds.

thingsToDo.name: Tour the island
thingsToDo.text: Enjoy a scenic drive through the countryside to historic Barbados. Then, head to Bathsheba and see the iconic pounding surf on the rugged East Coast.

thingsToDo.name: Snorkel away
thingsToDo.text: Sail on a deluxe catamaran for a fascinating visit with sea turtles. Then, snorkel your way to a shallow shipwreck teeming with brilliantly hued marine life.

thingsToDo.name: Take a submarine tour
thingsToDo.text: Submerge to depths of 150 feet for an underwater adventure. Take in the amazing sights of colorful coral, and tropical marine life outside your window.

name: Puerto Rico
description: Puerto Rico offers a distinctive blend of Spanish, European, native, and American culture. Trade wind breezes temper the Caribbean sun, and natural marvels abound. Whether you’re strolling San Juan’s old world-style streets, discovering its 500-year-old San Felipe del Morro citadel, or partying the night away at San Juan’s clubs and casinos, there’s a little something for everyone.
weather: Temperatures average in the mid-80s, but weather can be cooler in the mountains. June 1 – November 30 is hurricane season.
bestTimeToVisit: The busiest time to visit is in the winter; mid-April to the end of May are less crowded and offer beautiful weather.

thingsToDo.name: Paddle the Brightest Bioluminescent Bay in the World
thingsToDo.text: The brightest bioluminescent bay in Puerto Rico (and the world) is Mosquito Bay on the island of Vieques, (or explore the two mainland bays in Fajardo and La Parguera).

thingsToDo.name: Take the Ferry to Culebra Island
thingsToDo.text: On Culebra, you can visit the remote white-sand Flamenco Beach, celebrated as one of the most beautiful beaches in the world.

thingsToDo.name: Stroll Old San Juan
thingsToDo.text: Wander the narrow, European-style streets of Old San Juan, admire the colorful architecture, and visit the 16th century citadel of San Felipe del Morro.

thingsToDo.name: Dry Forest, Rainforest
thingsToDo.text: Puerto Rico is a land of diverse ecosystems: visit El Yunque rainforest and then travel to the island’s south coast and hike the Guánica Dry Forest, with its cacti and bird-watching opportunities.

name: Dominican Republic
description: The Dominican Republic boasts 1000 miles of coastline and cities as unique as the landscape. Sip a Caribbean rum punch on the white sands of an exclusive Punta Cana resort. Travel to the protected bay of Samaná, where thousands of humpback whales mate in the winter. Splash around in Samaná’s waterfalls surrounded by lush tropical plants. Soak in the sunshine on the shores of Puerto Plata at the foot of Mount Isabel de Torres.
weather: Year-round warm, tropical weather. June 1 – November 30 is hurricane season.
bestTimeToVisit: Peak season runs from December – May, which brings northern crowds escaping the winter. Pack an umbrella for October.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Tallest Waterfall in the Caribbean
thingsToDo.text: Samana is home to the Caribbean’s tallest waterfall, the Salto La Jalda, a stunning 400-foot tall cascade.

thingsToDo.name: Ride a Horse into the Surf
thingsToDo.text: After a day of lounging on the beach, experience the shore from another perspective—on horseback.

thingsToDo.name: Ride a Cable Car to the Peak of Mount Isabel de Torres
thingsToDo.text: From Puerto Plata, take a spectacular cable car ride to the peak of Mount Isabel de Torres and admire views of the sea and city from the summit.

thingsToDo.name: Get Your Thrills Parasailing or Zip Lining in Punta Cana
thingsToDo.text: When you’re in the mood for a thrill, go on a parasailing adventure over the water or soar on a zip line over the lush tropical landscape.

name: Costa Rica
description: From rainforests to volcanic highlands; from the bird-populated wetlands to the breathtaking surf of the Caribbean and Pacific beaches—Costa Rica is a nation that puts conservation first. Active adventures abound: surf, zip line, golf, hike, bird watch, paddle, fish, and dive. Costa Rica is also known for its luxury spas and yoga retreats.
weather: The forecast is sunny and 72˚, though mountain temperatures can be cooler.
bestTimeToVisit: November through April is the dry season and the best time to visit.

thingsToDo.name: In Touch with Nature
thingsToDo.text: One of the world’s great eco-tourism hotspots—a quarter of Costa Rica’s land is designated nature reserve; visit the Arenal Volcano, Manuel Antonio, Palo Verde, Corcovado, and Carara National Parks.

thingsToDo.name: Catch a Wave
thingsToDo.text: Costa Rica is a world-renowned surf destination; there’s Tamarindo, Jaco, and Malpais on the Pacific, and Westfalia on the Caribbean coast.

thingsToDo.name: Find Your Beach
thingsToDo.text: With 750 miles of Caribbean and Pacific coastline, discover your beach—there’s Puntarenas, Playa Tambor, Playa Montezuma, and Manuel Antonio National Park—to name just a few.

thingsToDo.name: Go on a Yoga Retreat
thingsToDo.text: Rejuvenate your body and spirit at a spa and yoga retreat where you can expand your practice and enjoy a massage by the sea.

name: Panama
description: Panama is a land of rainforests, exotic wildlife, and stunning Caribbean and Pacific beaches. While many visitors come to Panama for its wilderness escapes, most come for the Panama Canal, a 50-mile waterway that links the Pacific and Atlantic Oceans. Don’t let the canal’s relatively short distance fool you. This stretch of water is an engineering wonder. The Gatun, the Pedro Miguel, and the Miraflores locks flood with water, lifting ships above sea level, allowing them to complete their journey between two oceans.
bestTimeToVisit: Visit during the dry season, mid-December to April
weather: The forecast is 82˚ and sunny, with high humidity

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Locks
thingsToDo.text: Learn about the Panama Canal’s engineering marvels at the Miraflores, Gatun, or Pedro Miguel locks, where you can see massive ships navigating this impressive technological feat.

thingsToDo.name: Walk or Bike the Amador Causeway
thingsToDo.text: The Amador Causeway connects Panama City to the islands of Naos, Culebra, Perico, and Flamenco—walk or bike it for the best views.

thingsToDo.name: Escape to the Islands of Guna Yala
thingsToDo.text: If you’re looking for an exotic Caribbean beach escape—the 365 islands of Guna Yala deliver talcum-powder soft sand, technicolor bright water, and stunning coral reefs.

name: Maldives
description: In the Maldives, each resort is on its own private island and it’s the law that all resort guests enjoy beachfront views, meaning that honeymooners can enjoy incredible privacy. Explore white-sand beaches and plunge into technicolor blue seas. Diving and snorkeling in the Maldives is world-renown. And then, there’s the fresh catch of the day.
bestTimeToVisit: Visit between January and April for the best weather
weather: The forecast is warm and sunny between January and April, with May to November bringing the rainy season and monsoons

thingsToDo.name: Dive with Manta Rays
thingsToDo.text: The Maldives are famous for the incredible diving and snorkeling opportunities the islands offer; bring your waterproof camera for breathtaking underwater photos.

thingsToDo.name: A Beach of Your Own
thingsToDo.text: White-sands, shallow waters, brilliant turquoise waves—with thousands of islands, there’s a private beach just for you in the Maldives.

thingsToDo.name: Go Fishing
thingsToDo.text: Catch the big one on a sport fishing cruise; giant trevally, sailfish, marlin, barracuda, yellowfin tuna, wahoo, swordfish, and other species can be found in the waters around the Maldives.

name: Mauritius
description: Mauritius was shaped by volcanoes, but this charming island seems designed for honeymooners, nature enthusiasts, and those looking for a little luxury under the sun. Venture to the otherworldly Seven Colored Earths of Chamarel. At Black River Gorges National Park, view some of the rarest bird species on earth.
weather: May through September bring warm and dry weather; October through April are hot and humid with the risk of cyclones between January through March
bestTimeToVisit: May through August bring the best weather.

thingsToDo.name: Island of Markets
thingsToDo.text: Shop for fresh fruit, vegetables, and spices at Port Louis’s Central Market; admire the silks, textiles, and taste the street food at Mahébourg’s Monday Market, or browse the duty-free shops for some tax-free souvenirs.

thingsToDo.name: Afternoon Tea at Bois Chéri
thingsToDo.text: Visit the Bois Chéri tea estate where you can enjoy a tea tasting or afternoon tea service.

thingsToDo.name: Go in Search of Rare Species
thingsToDo.text: After the Dodo went extinct, Mauritius takes its conservation seriously; Black River Gorges National Park is home to the endemic echo parakeet and other rare bird species.

name: Qatar
description: Discover the authentic Arabic culture in Qatar, one of the world’s fastest-growing destinations. In Doha, shimmering new skyscrapers rise around bustling souqs. Wander the stalls of Souq Waqif, shopping for traditional clothing, spices, perfumes, and incense. Visit the Falcon Souq and see the falcons. No visit to Qatar is complete without spending a night in a traditional Bedouin camp under the stars.
weather: Enjoy warm and dry weather year-round
bestTimeToVisit: Year-round

thingsToDo.name: Go Dune Bashing
thingsToDo.text: Feel the thrill of riding a 4x4 over the desert dunes. Choose your thrill—high-speed roller coaster ride or scenic drive?

thingsToDo.name: Spend a Night in a Bedouin Camp
thingsToDo.text: See beautiful camels up close, enjoy a traditional Arabian meal, and fall asleep under the desert stars. You’ll feel like you stepped back in time.

thingsToDo.name: Stroll Doha’s Corniche
thingsToDo.text: Glimpse Doha’s blend of ancient traditions and cosmopolitan style with a stroll on the Corniche. Ride a traditional dhow boat, visit the Museum of Islamic Art, fly a kite, and admire the brilliant skyscrapers rising over the Persian Gulf.

thingsToDo.name: Visit Al Zubara Fort
thingsToDo.text: Learn about Qatar’s ancient role in the Persian Gulf at the UNESCO World Heritage Al Zubara Fort.

name: United Arab Emirates
description: Experience the magic of Arabia when you travel to the United Arab Emirates with Liberty Travel. Explore Dubai, a cosmopolitan city with iconic skyscrapers and palm-shaped islands. Visit Abu Dhabi, the ultra-modern capital with spectacular mosques and award-winning amusement parks. Discover Sharjah, the hub of art and heritage with its museums and galleries dedicated to the Emirati culture.
weather: Scorching hot in the summer to mild and pleasant in the winter.
bestTimeToVisit: In the winter when the temperatures are milder.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque
thingsToDo.text: This masterpiece of contemporary Islamic architecture in Abu Dhabi boasts of more than 80 domes, 1000 pillars, 100,000 tons of pure white Greek marble, and the world’s largest chandelier.

thingsToDo.name: Hop on a desert safari tour
thingsToDo.text: Go dune bashing in a 4x4, ride a camel in the desert, then go sand boarding down a sand dune…Dubai doesn’t get more thrilling than this.

thingsToDo.name: Break at the Sharjah Car Museum
thingsToDo.text: A must for car buffs, the Museum hosts some of the most beautiful and rare classic cars in the world.

name: Canada
bestTimeToVisit: Winter brings skiers to the slopes, and summer brings tourists to the cities and main attractions. Spring brings blossoms to Canada’s many gardens, and fall foliage is spectacular, though these seasons can be cold and rainy.
description: From the skyscrapers of Toronto, to the west coast vibe of Vancouver, Canada’s cities offer exquisite gardens, world-class museums, and multicultural cuisine. Beyond the cities is the rugged country. From the ski slopes of Whistler to the fairy tale hotel of Chateau Lake Louise in Banff, the west coast is ideal for hikers, skiers, and sightseers. The east coast has iconic Niagara Falls and the wineries of Niagara-on-the-Lake.
weather: West coast climate is temperate and mild, but wet. The east coast can get quite cool in the winter, and quite hot in the summer.

thingsToDo.name: Ride the Maid of the Mist at Niagara Falls
thingsToDo.text: Book yourself a ticket on the Maid of the Mist—the views are truly spectacular.

thingsToDo.name: Eat at the Revolving Restaurant in the CN Tower
thingsToDo.text: See Toronto from the top of the CN Tower; North America’s tallest free-standing structure boasts a revolving restaurant, offering 360-degree views.

thingsToDo.name: Ski Canada
thingsToDo.text: Mont Tremblant brings European-style alpine charm to the east coast, while the west boasts Whistler, which hosted the 2010 Olympic Games.

name: New Zealand
description: New Zealand is a land of lush forests, glacier-covered peaks, and beautiful beaches. Travel for the scenery, and explore the charming cities—from Auckland in the north to Wellington and Christchurch in the south. Lord of the Rings fans can discover the natural setting where the movies were filmed. Enjoy a warm Māori welcome and visit a marae—a Māori meeting place—where you can watch a war dance and learn about Māori art and culture.
weather: Enjoy the mild subtropical climate year-round, but pack a jacket if you plan to travel into alpine areas or want to go far south in the winter
bestTimeToVisit: Come for the New Zealand summer (January, February, and early March) for the best weather

thingsToDo.name: Vineyards and Scenery
thingsToDo.text: Travel to the celebrated Hawke’s Bay, home to New Zealand’s oldest wineries, or venture into the more remote mountain wine regions of Nelson or Waitaki Valley.

thingsToDo.name: Feast with the Maori
thingsToDo.text: After soaking in the hot springs of Rotorua, visit the Maori village and partake in a traditional Hangi meal, cooked in an earthen pit and steamed to perfection over heated rocks.

thingsToDo.name: Hike a Glacier
thingsToDo.text: Put on your crampons and take a guided hike on the spectacular Franz Josef Glacier.

thingsToDo.name: Galaxies of Glowworms
thingsToDo.text: Journey beneath the earth and view the breathtakingly beautiful glowworms at the Waitomo Glowworm Caves.
